title: Zilon
author: Zilon
content: Is there anything that can be done to resolve the negative trust or is this the final judgement on this account?

comments.author: Gladitorcomeback
comments.created_time: September 23, 2023, 06:22:07 PMLast edit: September 23, 2023, 06:38:57 PM by Gladitorcomeback
comments.body: Your question answer has been given by jollygood in negative review. QuoteI will remove/revise the tags if any compelling evidence is presented: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5452661.msg62297109#msg62297109  You got three red trust from different users and chance of removing is almost zero. you have cheated through different accounts and abuse forum rules. What do you think on which basis your negative removed?

comments.author: SmartGold01
comments.body: Negatives trust are given to you based on your insincerity and performance toward the forum and they are being issued to you by three reputable users this is to show a solid judgement on your accounts for not obeying and follows the forum rules as it was stated, I doubt if you could have a better chance to get them removed and even if you succeeded removing one rest two tags still shows another serious case in you. And if I may are you guilty of the said information on the tag given to you? If yes then sorry there's no other way to get them removed.

comments.author: _BlackStar
comments.body: Quote from: Zilon on September 23, 2023, 06:19:43 PMIs there anything that can be done to resolve the negative trust or is this the final judgement on this account?Of course there is - but you must be able to convince all users who provide negative tags by proving the accusations are not true. You can resolve it in PM or with this thread - but if you really want to get the tag removed, then prepare your own defense.But how can you make a rebuttal if your case is really valid as has been proven here: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5452661.msg62242194#msg62242194

comments.author: decodx
comments.body: Quote from: Zilon on September 23, 2023, 06:19:43 PMIs there anything that can be done to resolve the negative trust or is this the final judgement on this account?Trust isn't moderated on this forum, which means the only way to clear your negative trust is to address it directly with the members who left it on your profile.In your situation, I can see there are well-founded suspicions and compelling evidence linking your account to at least two other accounts that have also received negative ratings. Given these circumstances, it's challenging for you to provide a convincing justification that could clear your name.

comments.author: Rikafip
comments.body: Quote from: Zilon on September 23, 2023, 06:19:43 PMIs there anything that can be done to resolve the negative trust or is this the final judgement on this account?While generally is possible to get negative feedback removed, in your case chances of that happening are slim to none due evdeince presented. So yeah, you can forget about milking bitcointalk with this account ever again, unless joining some scammy signature campaign that doesn't care about reputation of its participants.

comments.author: owlcatz
comments.body: Quote from: Zilon on September 23, 2023, 06:19:43 PMIs there anything that can be done to resolve the negative trust or is this the final judgement on this account?All you can do is try and get them to remove it. You ask this a bit oddly IMO. Did you purchase the account and not know this?

comments.author: SatoPrincess
comments.body: Quote from: Zilon on September 23, 2023, 06:19:43 PMIs there anything that can be done to resolve the negative trust or is this the final judgement on this account?I believe you know the answer to that question, I guess you’re looking for momentum or support from the community before going to the dms. But I will give you the answer to you question, the only way to get rid of a negative feedback is to ask the person who gave you the feedback to change/remove it, I doubt you will be able to get JG to review the feedback on your account if you don’t have new evidence that will support your case.

comments.author: sheenshane
comments.body: Quote from: Zilon on September 23, 2023, 06:19:43 PMIs there anything that can be done to resolve the negative trust or is this the final judgement on this account?There's strong evidence and might you have a slim chance to convince them.Once @JollyGood said, Quote from: JollyGood on May 14, 2023, 04:53:16 PMQuote from: Jawhead999 on May 14, 2023, 07:30:05 AMCorrect me if I'm wrong, but I haven't see @JollyGood ever remove his feedback, it will always stand, the difference is the color he use.I have removed and revised feedback on numerous occasions. I am not as strict or as stubborn as some might make me out to be  On several occasions I gave completely incorrect feedback and removed/revised it. On some occasions I revised the feedback after the member posted and contributed positively regularly over a period of time.You may try it in your case which we know is the only way to rig the negative tag or revise into a neutral if you're a lucky one.

comments.author: Stalker22
comments.body: Quote from: Zilon on September 23, 2023, 06:19:43 PMIs there anything that can be done to resolve the negative trust or is this the final judgement on this account?This reminded me of this thread: "How much longer will JollyGood take to reverse his feedback?" It did not end well for you back then. Why do you think it will be any different this time?

comments.author: PytagoraZ
comments.body: Quote from: Zilon on September 23, 2023, 06:19:43 PMIs there anything that can be done to resolve the negative trust or is this the final judgement on this account?As far as I know, you can PM them and provide proof if their accusations are false. You can also create a thread equipped with evidence that you don't deserve to be tagged negatively. However, if their accusations are true, it is better to forget it because that is the final decision. Besides, you are dealing with those people (who tagged you) and 1000% they will not change itBut you don't need to worry because with a negative tag you can still discuss... So it's no problem, right?
